content.description:
Right off the road cut (ditch). Follow the obvious scrub line traversing left under a small roof. Pull the roof on a good crimp, step right, and walk up the slab on good feet and surprisingly decent pro.

Belay off the large dead tree (sounds worse than it is) just before the hiking trail.

Crappy route but it will take you to the upper tier and is less grovely than bushwacking up to the trail (i.e the walk off)
content.protection: Singles to 2". A small nut is nice above the roof, but it's easy ground.
content.location: Look for the obvious scrub line on the only wall right off the road (on the left, maybe 100 yards before the Monte Cristo trailhead).

content.description:
Head up an open book, avoiding the abundant moss and a couple ferns. Yard on Harambe's nose to gain the block above and slightly right of his face (his left brow... see pic). From here, step up and under the roof and place a much needed first piece. A half step left will take you to the awesome lieback flake (5.7 crux) up to easy featured slab covered in solid moss.

Route is mossy, but but I cleaned off enough that it should affect the climb too much.
content.protection: Gear to 5", but you could run it out on a BD #4
content.location: Look for the historic railroad sign; when facing it, the upper tier is to your right. Harambe is on the right is end before it gets slabby. You'll see the obvious monkey face in the wall.
